result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc A Newel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Pay all applicable court costs and fees, including DNA by 11/02/16 or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 3 days served, Straight Time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marc A Newel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marc A Newel in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Marc A Newel in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
-CASE SPUN TO BRANCH 45 (HONORABLE JUDGE ACKERMAN-HAVAS FOR BRANCH 37 (HONORABLE JUDGE T. CHRISTOPHER DEE). Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Marc A Newel not in court, in custody and not produced.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. COURT RETAINED COURT FILE.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Marc A Newel not in court, in custody not produced.  Court waives defendant's appearance for today's proceedings.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR NEXT SCHEDULED HEARING.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Marc A Newel not in court, in custody at MSDF and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.

Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Marc A Newel not in court, in custody at MSDF and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marc A Newel in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time to review with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marc A Newel in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Marc A Newel in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
